title: Festival of Ghosts
outcome: Citizens commemorate all those erased by the BCI with public rituals, sparking a citywide reckoning about memory, forgiveness, and rebuilding trust. As many of the 'ghosted' begin to emerge, the boundaries between victim and participant blur, and Stenograd is transformed as its people take ownership of their own history.

events.description: Wall murals and silent vigils appear citywide featuring names and faces of those erased from records by the BCI. Grieving families publicly reclaim lost relatives.
Free zone councils organize nightly remembrance parades. People read out names of the vanished, some of whom finally return, encouraged by system collapse.

Open forums focus on stories of survival, complicity, and resistance. Formerly erased citizens tell how they navigated life in hiding, prompting uncomfortable truths and widespread forgiveness campaigns.
Council loyalists attempt to dismiss the growing movement, but mass crowds demand recognition for the disappeared. Former BCI officials are pressured to account for ghosting policies.
A new civic pact, shaped by all voices, is ratified in a citywide assembly focused on memory, justice, and the promise that no one will be forgotten again.
